text: do you have a build pipeline like gulp?

JSON doesn’t have a way of commenting, but you can , if you really want comments, strip them as part of a build process (it’s going to mess up code highlighting though)
You could also look at writing your config files in YML and using a YML -> JSON step.
If we import a theme via the CLI into another portal does it have to be enabled for the themes functionality still?
at the moment, only two colors are possible

Technically all portals have the ability to have themes now, but there are a few things we’re still ungating that help themes make more sense on the Marketer’s side. Feel free to slack me any portal IDs and I can ungate them.

We’re planning to have all of this stuff rolled out in the next few weeks.
What about HubL comments? Is HubL parsed in these files?
Thanks <@UQERM7BLY> !  I don’t necessarily need the pipes. That’s just what I see used at the top of Json files.
<@U3A4KEWK1> I’ll try with HubL comments. I was just hoping for more of a block for easier recognition on scroll.
I don’t imagine hubl will be parsed in these files - as i recall the HubSpot cli library actually runs these .json files through JSON.parse
